geninfo.para: This TSI covers installation of the Crankcase Breather Assembly. Service diagnostic procedures for the detection of high and low exhaust restriction in Catalyzed Diesel Particulate Filters (CDPF) will also be presented.

svcproc.title: Crankcase breather Installation Procedure

para.emph:
To assemble and install the Crankcase Breather Assembly, follow steps 1 through 13 listed below.
for torque requirements.
for a detailed diagram. Refer to Figure 1 for listed Item numbers.

step1.para: Loosely connect the breather bracket (Item 10) to the breather assembly (Item 2). Use two M8 x 20 hex. hd. flange bolts (Item 8).

Attach the breather vent hose (Item 4) to the breather vent tube assembly (Item 6). Loosely fit two 13/16 - 1 3/4 inch hose clamps (Item 3) over the breather vent hose. Next, connect the breather vent hose to the breather assembly.

Be aware that one O-ring, with an outer diameter of 32.06 mm (1.262 in) is included in the crankcase breather assembly. Before proceeding to step 4, make sure that the O-ring is indeed attached to the breather inlet tube (Item 1).
Firmly secure the breather tube extension hose (Item 15) to the breather vent tube assembly using one 13/16-1 3/4 inch hose clamp.
Connect the breather assembly to the engine. Loosely insert two M10 x 20 hex. hd. flange bolt (Item 7), and one M12 x 20 socket hd. bolt (Item 11) into the cylinder head and crankcase mounting holes.
Assemble the male flex fitting connector (Item 16) to the side of the crankcase.
Lubricate the smaller 16.18 mm (.637 in) O-ring (Item 5). Attach the O-ring to the breather drain tube assembly (Item 12).

Attach the drain tube clip (Item 13) to the breather drain tube assembly. Be sure that O-ring is sealed in face of crankcase breather assembly. Place the flat side of the drain tube clip against the oil filter header mounting stud. Tighten the flex fitting nut. Torque the breather drain tube assembly to the oil filter header mounting stud with an M8 hex flange nut (Item 14).
Torque two M10 x 20 hex. hd. flange bolts, and the M12 x 20 socket hd. bolt, to tighten the crankcase breather assembly to the head and crankcase.
Install the breather drain tube retainer. Torque one M8 x 20 hex. hd. bolt, to secure it .
Press on the front of the crankcase breather assembly by hand, to insure that the large 32.06 mm (1.262 in) O-ring is firmly seated in the valve cover.
Torque the M8 x 20 hex. hd. flange bolts that secure the breather bracket to the breather assembly.
Tighten the 13/16-1 3/4 inch hose clamps that connect the breather vent hose to the breather vent tube.

entry.para: M8 nut for drain tube clip

item.para: Omission of the drain tube clip, or failure to install it over the stud, may cause premature return line cracks.
Under torquing M10 hex. hd. flange bolt and M12 socket hd. bolts, or over torquing flex fittings, may cause part damage or leaks.

randlist.title: Drain Tube Retainer Clip Procedural Highlights

item.para: Over torquing, or failure to torque, retainer clips may result in damaged threads.
Under torquing retainer clips may cause oil to leak.
Omitting retainer clips may lead to oil leakage.

svcproc.title: CDPF service interval warning light
svcproc.para: The Green Diesel Engine features a service interval warning. A system trigger activates the amber "Check Engine" light which will continue to flash on and off at one second intervals until the light has been reset by the procedure below. No fault code will be stored when the amber light is flashing. If the "Check Engine" light remains on (i.e. no flashing), then a fault code has been stored and normal engine diagnostics should be performed.

This service interval warning trigger is based on the number of miles a vehicle has accumulated since the CDPF has last been serviced. The service interval warning trigger level is factory calibrated at 48,300 Km (30,000 miles), and is not customer programmable.

If necessary, the service interval can be reprogrammed using Master Diagnostics (MD) version v.3.21. MD v.3.21 will allow the technician to view the vehicle mileage at which the last CDPF service light reset occurred, as well as engine hours and total fuel consumed.

svcproc.stitle: TSI 02-12-02 - Selected Green Diesel Procedures and Assemblies
svcproc.title: CDPF service interval warning light reset
svcproc.para: After inspection and servicing of CDPF, reset the system as follows:

step1.para: Turn keyswitch to ON position.
Push and hold STI button.
Press and release brake pedal 3 times.
Release STI button.

note.para: This operation MUST BE completed within 7 seconds of key ON. The CDPF service interval warning light will now turn off and will reactivate when next inspection is due.

svcproc.title: CDPF Service Diagnostic Procedure for High Or Low Exhaust Restriction Levels

para.emph:
To determine whether or not the Catalyzed Diesel Particulate Filter (CDPF) is operational and functioning properly, follow the test procedures listed below.
for a detailed diagram. Refer to Figure 2 for listed Item numbers.

warning.para: To prevent possible personal injury or death, when measuring the CDPF inlet restriction, make sure that the wheels are chocked, and the transmission is in neutral.

step1.para: Visually inspect the exhaust system for signs of damage. Repair broken or leaking parts as needed. Inspect inside the tailpipe (Item 7) or stack. If sooting is present inside the tail pipe just past the CDPF (Item 6) , the CDPF element may have failed.
Remove the 1/4 NPT pipe plug (Item 4) located at the top of the CDPF inlet pipe.

Connect a minimum of one foot of coiled copper tubing to the pipe fitting prior to attaching the plastic tubing from the pressure gauge. (See Figure 3) Ensure that all connections are leak free. Note that the coiled copper tubing prevents the plastic tube from melting.
Connect the 0-5 psig pressure gauge.
Fully warm-up the engine, so that the coolant temperature is 82-88 degrees Celsius (180 - 190 degrees Fahrenheit).
Take measurements with the accelerator pedal pressed to the floor at high idle speed.

. Pressures that exceed the specifications listed in Table 2 indicate a restriction in the CDPF. A restricted CDPF may cause a reduction in engine power or fuel economy. Pressures lower than the specification can indicate an exhaust leak, or failed CDPF.

svcproc.title: Correcting high exhaust restriction

item.para: If the CDPF is full of ash, service the CDPF as specified in the maintenance procedures listed in Service Manual S07001.

Should the CDPF become plugged with soot, clean the CDPF. For CDPF cleaning procedures, refer to Service Manual S07001. To ensure an adequate exhaust temperature for filter regeneration, investigate the vehicle's operating characteristics.
In the case of a collapsed or restricted exhaust pipe, replace parts as required.

svcproc.stitle: TSI 02-12-02 - Selected Green Diesel Procedures and Assemblies
svcproc.title: Correcting low exhaust restriction

item.para: If the pressure gauge is not operating, or is not calibrated, repair or replace the pressure gauge, and calibrate it.
In case of a leak in pressure gauge connections, tighten the connection, and replace the lines that lead from the gauge.
Should exhaust leak between the exhaust manifold and CDPF, repair the leaks.
If the CDPF cracks or fails, replace the center section of the CDPF.
